creditline: Lent by Carol and Jeffrey Horvitz
description: Rounded vessel with wide mouth; bands of oribe glaze; circular and straight carved lines
medium: Stoneware with oribe and iron oxide glazes
text: Born and raised in Tokoname, Koie Ryo_ji has fashioned clay his entire life--first as a factory worker and then as an artist.  His approach to clay is visceral and highly expressive, but he produces a full range of objects from non-functional sculptural work to traditional tea wares. For the last decade, he has produced many bell-shaped vessels such as this one. Wide-bottomed and stable, these simple vases serve as "canvas" for his seemingly casual application of glazes. Here, a thick, glassy Oribe glaze runs in heavy rivulets down the surface of the form.
title: (Vessel with wide mouth)
